members.name: Will Murphy
members.desc: I joined the team at the beginning of summer 2016 and worked on the front motor to help the bike balance. This past semester, I was the systems sub-team lead, during which I worked on gathering data from our various sensors and giving the balance controller the information it needs to balance. More generally I am a junior interested in robotics, mechatronics and controls. I also am in Sigma Pi fraternity on campus, and I rowed for a year for the Cornell lightweights. I enjoy playing various sports and being outside when I'm not working on the bike!

members.name: Kyle Fenske
members.desc: I am the business team lead on this project team. On campus, I am an orientation leader and serve on the executive boar for my fraternity. I am interested in working in the field of consulting, supply chain management, an overall business-oriented engineering fields.

members.name: Rohit Bandaru
members.desc: I am an engineering student who enjoys using innovative technologies for different applications. I primarily work with the web team and developed this website! I am also a member of the Cornell iGEM synthetic biology project team.

members.name: Olav Imsdahl
members.desc: I enjoy working hands-on and solving problems in the lab. I'm also on the lightweight crew team and play piano. My current project is to work on a new Steer by wire bike which is my Meng Project.

members.name: David Miron
members.desc: On campus I am involved in a social fraternity and I am an Outdoor Odyssey Guide. I contribute to the Steer by Wire team by working on hardware and interaction between electronic components.

members.name: Kenneth Fang
members.desc: I am interested in robotics in general, as well as theatre design. I have been helping out with software. Aside from the team, I am also on Cornell's Wushu team and Lion Dance club.

members.name: Conrad McCarthy
members.desc: I have a passion for robotics and product design. On campus I am vice president of Spark Product and Industrial Design, a researcher for the Architectural Robotics Lab and a member of Cornell's Sprint Football team. For Autonomous Bicycle, I help design and build the mechanical assembly of the steer-by-wire system for the new bicycle.

members.name: Arundathi Sharma
members.desc: After spending 1.5 years as team lead, I am spending my last semester at Cornell focusing in on my technical interests with this project: balance control, computer simulation, and bicycle dynamics. In addition to working on Bike Team, I am a member of the Language House. Aside from building robots, I like learning about food cultures, systems, and cultivation, and I enjoy picking up new languages.
